sets.set_reasoning: The Wide Grip Lat Pull Down is chosen to target the lats and mid traps, essential for a thicker back. With 3 sets of 10 reps, it aligns with the beginner's volume recommendation of 3-6 sets per muscle group per session. This exercise is stable and allows for easy progression, making it suitable for someone with less than 3 months of experience.

exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Wide Grip Lat Pull Down.

sets.set_reasoning: The Chest Supported Row is included to focus on the lats and midback, contributing to back thickness. With 3 sets of 10 reps, it complements the volume needed for beginners, ensuring a balanced approach to back development.

exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Chest Supported Row.

sets.set_reasoning: The Cable Row is selected to provide a deep stretch and contraction for the lats, essential for back thickness. With 3 sets of 10 reps, it ensures the user reaches the recommended volume for beginners, focusing on effective back development.

exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the Cable Row.

workout_explanation: This workout plan is structured to meet the user's goal of developing a thicker back within a 30-minute session. The exercises are ordered to target different parts of the back, ensuring comprehensive development. Each exercise is performed for 3 sets of 10 reps, aligning with the beginner's volume recommendation. The rest periods are kept short (60 seconds) to fit within the time constraint while allowing sufficient recovery. The exercises chosen are beginner-friendly, stable, and allow for easy progression, making them suitable for someone with less than 3 months of experience. The plan ensures the user reaches the recommended weekly volume for back development, focusing on both the lats and mid traps/midback, which are crucial for achieving a thicker back.
